get_next_node.f90

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 ! ===========================================
00002 !
00003 !           GET_NEXT_NODE
00004 !
00005 ! $Revision$
00006 !
00007 !   Function to return key of next node in local tree-walk
00008 !   
00009 !
00010 ! ===========================================
00011 
00012 function next_node(keyin)
00013 
00014   use treevars
00015 
00016   implicit none
00017   integer*8 :: next_node
00018   integer*8 :: keyin
00019   integer :: nodeout
00020   logical :: resolved
00021   logical, dimension(8) :: keymatch
00022   integer*8, dimension(8) :: child_key, child_sub
00023 
00024 
00025   integer, dimension(8) :: child_addr !  children nodes
00026 
00027   integer*8 :: node_key, search_key, parent,  child_top
00028   integer :: cell_addr, node_addr, parent_node, child_byte, nchild
00029   integer :: jmatch(1), j
00030   integer :: key2addr        ! Mapping function to get hash table address from key
00031 
00032   search_key = keyin                   
00033   node_key = keyin                     ! keep key, address of node 
00034   node_addr = key2addr(keyin)
00035   resolved = .false.
00036 
00037   !   Search for next sibling, uncle, great-uncle etc
00038 
00039   do while (.not. resolved .and. search_key > 1)
00040      parent =  ishft(search_key,-3)                 ! parent
00041      parent_node = htable( key2addr( parent ) )%node   ! parent node pointer
00042 
00043      child_byte = htable( key2addr( parent ) )%childcode                           !  Children byte-code
00044      nchild = SUM( (/ (ibits(child_byte,j,1),j=0,7) /) )                   ! # children = sum of bits in byte-code
00045      child_sub(1:nchild) = pack( bitarr, mask=(/ (btest(child_byte,j),j=0,7) /) )  ! Extract child sub-keys from byte code
00046      child_top = ishft(parent,3)  
00047      child_key(1:nchild) = IOR( child_top, child_sub(1:nchild) )         ! Construct keys of children
00048 
00049      keymatch=.false.
00050      keymatch(1:nchild) = (/ (child_key(j) == search_key,j=1,nchild) /)
00051      jmatch = pack(bitarr, mask = keymatch ) + 1                                  ! Pick out position of current search key in family
00052 
00053      if (jmatch(1) < nchild ) then                                                ! if search_key has 'elder' sibling then
00054         next_node  = child_key(jmatch(1)+1)                        ! store next_node as sibling of parent/grandparent
00055         resolved = .true.
00056      else
00057         search_key = ishft(search_key, -3)                                     ! Go up one level 
00058      endif
00059   end do
00060 
00061   if (.not. resolved .and. search_key == 1) next_node  = 1        ! Top-right corner reached: set pointer=root
00062 
00063 end function next_node
